# Lunar Longing: A Reflection of Eternal Purpose
## Scripture
"But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people belonging to God, that you may declare the praises of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light." - 1 Peter 2:9

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the night sky, we're reminded of the lunar cycle - a constant ebb and flow of light and darkness. The phases of the moon can be seen as a metaphor for our journey of faith. Just as the moon waxes and wanes, our walk with God is marked by seasons of growth, illumination, and sometimes, darkness. Yet, even in the darkest phases, the moon remains, a constant presence in the night sky. Similarly, God's presence remains with us, guiding us through life's trials and uncertainties. As we navigate the ups and downs of our faith journey, we're called to declare the praises of God, who has called us out of darkness into his wonderful light.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we gaze up at the lunar landscape, remind us of your eternal presence in our lives. Help us to declare your praises, even in the darkest phases of our journey. May your light shine brightly in our hearts, guiding us through life's uncertainties, and may we remain faithful, reflecting your glory to a world in need of your love. Amen.
